title: Quinn and Valor
body:
Quinn is an adc that can change forms, But she is the only champion that swaps with another animal,
So for that reason i belive Quinn and valor have seperate gold, and seperate inventories, 
You have acces to valor at level 1 and u have to buy for both characters
So u have a total of 12 items but only 6 are used at a time.

replies.body: That is a pretty cool idea! It would be hard to balance and make intuitive (not just for the Quinn player, but for the opposing team as well), but it sounds neat :)
ORRR, when she switches to valor you can see quinn riding on his back xD
This sounds kinda cray cray. Could you imagine, you needed to get out of a fight so you went "Well, time to switch to my alacrity swiftness boots, Zephyr and full tank items!"?

One thing I'd like cleared up: are the gold gains different between forms or is it essentially 'double gold' but split between forms?

Either way there are some things to consider.

I'd say double gold but split in the two forms i guess, either is fine though.

Though there could be just a different shop for valor, where he has 6 items already
(Head, body, talons, wings, tail, beak) but you have to upgrade them, and they kind of work like the NEW jungle items, i guess that would be good aswell, so you can build damage or tanky and each part could do different things so its like leveling abilties in different order to do different things. 

Not sure about it but can do multiple things, Make it felxible i guess.

So something like Viktor's Hex Core, but 6 items for Valor? Personally I think that might be a bit complicated to implement and use. I'd say 1 or 2 would be a good number of such items, maybe even a trinket type thing like Rengar's Bonetooth Necklace that adds bonuses based on how many times you've changed between Quinn and Valor? Then just be able to purchase other items like normal. Another possibility could be that those items would build into items already in the store, but with that it does kind of limit your build paths if there's 6 items.

Maybe i meant that each of the items base gear is like a machete with little to no stats, and u ahve to upgrade it, the first upgrades are cheap and increases for each upgrade. Also each item has multiple upgrades to give different stats i guess.

I figured something like that, it's comparable to Viktor's Hex core just with multiple build paths instead. Like I said though that would be over complicated to implement and use for just one champion. I like the idea that Valor would start with items (or have unique items) but 6, each with multiple build paths, is too much. I think 1 or 2 would be enough and, as I said before, potentially a trinket comparable to Rengar's Bonetooth Necklace.

It was just an ideation or maybe Valor can buy one which greatly increases his stats or something, But i still think Quinn and Valor should have seperate inv slots, and when u go into valor form ur name changes to Valor because you are no longer Quinn.

> when u go into valor form ur name changes to Valor because you are no longer Quinn.

That I can definitely agree with. I mean they have Gnar as Mega Gnar when he changes form and he's the same person/champ.

Back on topic, I do think it's a great idea and I will support it, it's just working out the details that's tricky. I like having items just for Valor, it's just I don't think there should be more than 2 + (maybe) a trinket, especially if they're going to have multiple build paths.
